alert.note: Alert for Lee (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 09 at 6:03PM EDT by NWS Knoxville
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT EASTERN LEE COUNTY THROUGH 645 PM EDT... At 603 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Jonesville, moving northeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Jonesville, Pennington Gap, St. Charles, Dryden, and Pattonsville. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
